paragraphs.content: The LORD is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the LORD is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the Lord is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?

paragraphs.content: When the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.

paragraphs.content: Though an host should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear: though war should rise against me, in this will I be confident.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Though an host should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear: though war should rise against me, in this will I be confident.

paragraphs.content: One thing have I desired of the LORD, that will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of the LORD, and to inquire in his temple.
paragraphs.contentHtml: One thing have I desired of the Lord, that will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of the Lord, and to inquire in his temple.

paragraphs.content: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion: in the secret of his tabernacle shall he hide me; he shall set me up upon a rock.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion: in the secret of his tabernacle shall he hide me; he shall set me up upon a rock.

paragraphs.content: And now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the Lord.

paragraphs.content: Hear, O LORD, when I cry with my voice: have mercy also upon me, and answer me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear, O Lord, when I cry with my voice: have mercy also upon me, and answer me.

paragraphs.content: When thou saidst, Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee, Thy face, LORD, will I seek.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When thou saidst, Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee, Thy face, Lord, will I seek.

paragraphs.content: Hide not thy face far from me; put not thy servant away in anger: thou hast been my help; leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hide not thy face far from me; put not thy servant away in anger: thou hast been my help; leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.

paragraphs.content: When my father and my mother forsake me, then the LORD will take me up.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When my father and my mother forsake me, then the Lord will take me up.

paragraphs.content: Teach me thy way, O LORD, and lead me in a plain path, because of mine enemies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Teach me thy way, O Lord, and lead me in a plain path, because of mine enemies.

paragraphs.content: Deliver me not over unto the will of mine enemies: for false witnesses are risen up against me, and such as breathe out cruelty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Deliver me not over unto the will of mine enemies: for false witnesses are risen up against me, and such as breathe out cruelty.

paragraphs.content: I had fainted, unless I had believed to see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I had fainted, unless I had believed to see the goodness of the Lord in the land of the living.

paragraphs.content: Wait on the LORD: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wait on the Lord: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the Lord.
